clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Benzoyl peroxide is indicated for the treatment of mild to moderate acne vulgaris and rosacea Combined with other agents it may be used in the treatment of more severe acne

contraindications.disease: There is no evidence to support carcinogenicity in humans Benzoyl peroxide may cause contact hypersensitivity stinging and burning sensations when applied topically It should not be applied under occlusive dressings due to risk of sensitization During processing and formulation exposure to concentrations higher than 12 2 mg cu may cause irritation to the nose and or throat
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Benzoyl peroxide acts as an antibacterial irritant keratolytic comedolytic and anti inflammatory agent when applied topically to the human epithelium

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Benzoyl peroxide is combined with Dapsone
